sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Now. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One year on. In Afghanistan, the Taliban marks their first year in power with the country in the grip of one of the world's worst humanitarian crises.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Egypt, dozens of people are killed and many more injured after a fire rips through a Coptic church in the city of Giza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: many more injured after a fire ripped through a Coptic church in the city of Giza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And fears of a potential nuclear disaster at Ukraine's Zaporizhia power plant loom large after renewed shelling shuts down three turbines used to cool reactors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The first images of Taliban fighters inside the presidential palace in Kabul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Monday is exactly one year since the hardline Islamist movement took control of Afghanistan, nearly 20 years after it was ousted by U.S. forces following the 9-11 attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The collapse of rule by the U.S.-backed government has brought many changes for Afghans, particularly women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are now one year down the line from the Taliban takeover, and we're witnessing incredibly high levels of poverty in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We're seeing people with their salaries reduced, with their income reduced, with their income reduced, taking on greater debt, using coping strategies which include early marriage for girls, child labour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: These images from Saturday, a rare women's protest in Kabul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Around 40 women chanted bread, work and freedom as they marched through the streets before fleeing as armed men fired gunshots in the air.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Even in the past there were restrictions and violence against Afghan women, but they had hope because there were schools. Women and girls could serve the country through their knowledge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But now they have even lost their only hope, which was education.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Women have borne the brunt of changes in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But experts say with the ongoing drought, poor harvests and high inflation, it's not only for them that the future is bleak.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: high inflation, it's not only for them that the future is bleak. Relatives of the victims of one of Egypt's worst fire tragedies in recent years are mourning

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: the dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At least 41 people died, many of them children, when what's thought to have been an electrical fault sparked a blaze at a Coptic church in Giza City near Cairo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: About 5,000 people had been inside the building at the time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Flames and smoke blocked an entrance causing a stampede.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Some people reportedly jumped from higher floors of the building in an attempt to escape.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The church included a nursery for children. Witnesses described how people rushed into the burning building to rescue those trapped but were soon overwhelmed by the heat and smoke.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sixteen people were injured, including four policemen involved in the rescue effort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the country's chief prosecutor has ordered an investigation into the fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The team of prosecutors were dispatched to the church.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Most of the victims are said to have died from smoke inhalation. Author Salman Rushdie is on the road to recovery, but it will be a long one, according to his agent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Indian-born British novelist remains hospitalised in a critical condition following his stabbing in western New York State last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: week. His son Zafar said in a tweet that his father had been removed from a ventilator which allowed him to talk and demonstrate that his usual feisty and defiant sense of humour remains intact.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Earlier on Saturday Hadi Matar, the man charged over Friday's attack, pleaded not guilty to attempted murder.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The 24-year-old was detained on bail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The incident took place at a literary festival.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Mattar's motive is unclear, but it's believed he is sympathetic to the causes of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Rushdie has faced years of death threats for his novel, The Satanic Verses, which some Muslims see as blasphemous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He was forced into hiding when former Iranian leader Ayatollah Khomeini issued a fatwa or decree calling for Rushdie's assassination. The fatwa is still active.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Russian Defense Ministry has published footage of what it describes as the aftermath

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: of Ukrainian shelling at the Kyhukha hydroelectric power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Three of the six turbines are said to have been shut down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Disruptions to the power generation and water discharge systems could badly affect the cooling systems at the Zaporozhye nuclear reactors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Ukraine and Russia continue to raise safety fears at the Zaporozhye plant amid fresh shelling around the facility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: For locals living nearby, it stirs memories of the last nuclear disaster at Chernobyl.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: There's nothing good in what's going on, and we don't know how it will end up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: People are nervous as the nuclear power plant is nearby.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Often the wind blows in our direction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So the radiation will blow immediately to us and it will get into the water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In his latest nightly address, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has accused Russians who don't speak out against the war in Ukraine as being complicit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Zelenskyy has accused Russians who don't speak out against the war in Ukraine as being complicit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And no matter who you are, both on the territory of Russia and abroad, your voice should sound in support of Ukraine and against this war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the First World Food Programme wheat shipment for Ethiopia has left the Black Sea port of Odessa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The ship Brave Commander is carrying 23,000 metric tons of grain. Ethiopia is one of five countries already experiencing famine-like conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's Ministry of Infrastructure says more ships are leaving its Black Sea ports loaded with vital grain supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Barbados-flagged cargo ship and Marshall Island-flagged bulk carrier are the latest to leave the war-torn country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In these two ships alone, 14,500 tonnes of agricultural products have been exported, according to Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The ships will pass through Turkey, where a joint operations centre has been established by the UN, alongside representatives from Ukraine, Russia and Turkey, to check all shipments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After a series of negotiations, Russia lifted its blockade of Ukraine's ports in July to allow only food shipments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It brings the total number of ships to depart the country under this UN-brokered deal to 16.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Each day a crowd of people gathers in the eastern Finnish city of Immatera to see an

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: almost century-old dam being opened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's particularly popular with Russian tourists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And since the end of July, the spectacle kicks off with the Ukrainian national anthem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We have to make a choice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There's a lively debate here throughout Finland about whether we should stop giving visas to Russians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Of course, if they don't come here, then there will be a loss of income for businesses, and that's unfortunate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, it's essential that an independent country is not invaded and people don't die in war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: These are so much greater values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are strongly behind Ukraine in war. These are so much greater values. We are strongly behind Ukraine in this." Russian tourists are a big influence in Finland's border regions. Even so, with the government signalling strong support for Kyiv and making a historic application to join the NATO alliance, the mood is toughening. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's call to completely ban Russian tourists from the EU is not falling on deaf ears here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kenyans are praying for peace as tension rise while the counting continues following last

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: week's presidential election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: With only half of ballots counted, the delayed result is causing tempers to fray between opposing supporters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The race is a tight one, with only two percentage points separating frontrunners, Deputy President William Ruto and Prime Minister Ralia Odinga.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At least six people are dead and dozens more injured after an explosion tore through a popular market in Armenia's capital Yerevan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: According to local media, the explosion originated in a fireworks storage area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Some 350 emergency responders worked to extinguish the fire caused by the explosion, and rescue workers are still looking for survivors trapped under the rubble.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At least 16 people are still missing, according to authorities.
